item.title: Installation instructions
item.description: R For R, install from here. For RStudio, install from here. We recommend you have the latest versions of both R and RStudio: R version 3.6.1 (2019-07-05) RStudio version 1.1.456 Git Only for Git sessions, install Git from here. Bash Only for Bash/shell/terminal sessions. Mac OSX and Linux users will already have bash installed. For Windows users, install the Windows version of Git above to install Git Bash.

item.title: Licensing and attribution
item.description: Use and re-use The website content is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License and the code is licensed under a MIT License. This means that any content or code on this website can be used, copied, modified, and so on anywhere, as long as there is attribution. Website The website layout was modified from a template by Bootstrapious and ported to Hugo by DevCows. Images Images on the front page are all freely available from Unsplash.

item.title: Surveys
item.description: Help us understand what the community needs, tell us when and what you want to learn, or if you want to instruct a session! What works for you? Loading… What do you want to learn? Loading… Want to instruct? Loading…
